meaningMnemonic: For a <radical>car</radical>, a <radical>tombstone</radical> is <kanji>lightweight</kanji>. Cars are very strong, you see, so something heavy like a tombstone is no match for them. All cars find tombstones to be <kanji>light</kanji> and easy to transport.
readingMnemonic: What do you wish you had to transport this tombstone? Oh, that’s right, a car. So you need some kind of <reading>car</reading> <reading>loo</reading>phole (かる). If you had a car, this tombstone moving business would be no problem. To cars, tombstones are naught but <kanji>lightweight</kanji> pebbles! But the rules say you can't use cars to carry tombstones, so you need to find a car loophole.
